intro: Tordylium insulare, commonly known as the island tordylium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its small, tubular flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Tordylium insulare is adapted to coastal and disturbed habitats, showing resilience to salt spray and sandy soils.
